update.description:
The current strategy for determining poses of SDF DOM objects is to try to resolve the pose relative to the relative_to frame using libsdformat's API (currently ResolvePose). This could fail if the passed in DOM object was constructed without a containing sdf::Model, in which case, the raw pose will be used.

**Dependencies:**
  
  * [libsdformat branch `spec2_prototype_9`](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/branch/spec2_prototype_9).
update.title: [Citadel] Add support for sdformat frame semantics

content.raw:
I get this from running individual unit or integration tests, e.g. `./build/ignition-sensors3/bin/UNIT_Lidar_TEST`

we often create an `sdf::Sensor` object from without going through `sdf::Model,`e.g. [here](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-sensors/src/b40b8b9ddc4b36da8cd3b92a76b51c6bc1f2c871/src/Sensor.cc#lines-126)

content.raw: On `ign-gazebo` when components are deserialized, we create some `sdf::Sensor` objects without going through `sdf::Model`. Maybe it's somewhere there.

pull_request.title: [Citadel] Add support for sdformat frame semantics

pullrequest.title: [Citadel] Add support for sdformat frame semantics

content.raw: That's interesting. `SetXmlParentName` gets called when DOM objects like `sdf::Sensor` are loaded by `sdf::Model`. If the `sdf::Sensor` object was created directly `SetXmlParentName` won't be called. How are you running this?
content.html: That's interesting. SetXmlParentName gets called when DOM objects like sdf::Sensor are loaded by sdf::Model. If the sdf::Sensor object was created directly SetXmlParentName won't be called. How are you running this?

content.raw:
I’m seeing a few test failures running this branch with sdformat’s `spec2_prototype_9` branch

They output the same msg:

```
Exception [SemanticPose.cc:57] SDF ASSERTION                     
SemanticPose defaultResolveTo is empty
In function       : SemanticPose
Assert expression : !_defaultResolveTo.empty()
```

do we need to call `Sensor::SetXmlParentName` somewhere?
content.html:
I’m seeing a few test failures running this branch with sdformat’s spec2_prototype_9 branch

They output the same msg:

Exception [SemanticPose.cc:57] SDF ASSERTION                     
SemanticPose defaultResolveTo is empty
In function       : SemanticPose
Assert expression : !_defaultResolveTo.empty()

do we need to call Sensor::SetXmlParentName somewhere?
